did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Berryman United Methodist Church (Richmond, Va.) Records, 1913-2003

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Berryman United Methodist Church (Richmond, Va.) Records, 1913-2003. Accession 43173. Church records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Berryman United Methodist Church was organized in Richmond, Virginia on 5 October 1913 at the home of Rev. Albert C. Berryman. It was originally known as Woodland Heights Methodist Episcopal Church, South, and there were 34 members. The group met in a small wood frame structure until 1925, when a new building was constructed. Two years later, the name of the church was changed to Berryman Methodist Episcopal, in memory of the church's first pastor. There were two more name changes - in 1939, to Berryman Methodist Church, and in 1968, to Berryman United Methodist Church. A new educational building was constructed in 1938. In 2003, the church membership voted to merge with Mt. Pisgah United Methodist Church in Midlothian, Virginia, and Berryman ceased to exist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1913-2003, of Berryman United Methodist Church in Richmond, Virginia. Includes bulletins, charge conference materials, correspondence, membership rolls and transfers, minutes, newsletters, photographs, programs, reports, scrapbooks, Sunday school class rolls and record books, and yearbooks. There are also financial records, including account books, bank statements, budgets, check registers, contributions, invoices, ledgers, investment information, receipts, and treasurer's reports.
